intro: Mesembryanthemum thermarum, commonly known as the hot spring ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often blue or purple leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white, blooming in response to temperature changes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to extreme heat and drought conditions. Mesembryanthemum thermarum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
